problem_text: Suppose that S is a closed oriented surface of genus g > 1 and G = π1S = G1 ∗A G2, where G1 ̸= A ̸= G2 and the subgroup A is finitely generated (and hence free). Is this decomposition geometrical, that is, do there exist connected surfaces S1, S2, T such that S = S1 ∪S2, S1 ∩S2 = T, Gi = π1Si, A = π1T and embeddings Si ⊂S, T ⊂S induce, in a natural way, embeddings Gi ⊂G, A ⊂G? This is true for A = Z. H. Zieschang
answer: No, not always (O. V. Bogopolski, Geom. Dedicata, 94 (2002), 63–89).
